alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 4:40AM PST until January 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...POCKETS OF FREEZING RAIN...HEAVY SNOW CONTINUING OVER THE MOUNTAINS TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 7 and 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Holden Village, Stehekin, and Stevens Pass. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Steady heavy snow will decrease and give way to showers Friday afternoon and evening. A few showers could be heavy at times with snowfall rates near one inch per hour. Wet and heavy snow will produce severe winter driving conditions and the potential for localized tree damage due to heavy snow. Gusty winds will result in drifting and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
